20110121023359.000|20110121023402.000|CC1|ARCHIPELAGO OF CAPE VERDE.      
20110121023402.000|20110121023403.000|CC1|I LAND ON THE ISLAND OF         
20110121023403.000|20110121023417.000|CC1|SANTIAGO IN THE CAPITAL PRAIA.  
20110121023417.000|20110121023417.000|CC1|STEPPING OFF THE PLANE          
20110121023417.000|20110121023419.000|CC1|FROM DAKAR, THE FIRST THING YOU 
20110121023419.000|20110121023420.000|CC1|NOTICE IS HOW LAID BACK         
20110121023420.000|20110121023421.000|CC1|IT IS HERE.                     
20110121023421.000|20110121023422.000|CC1|THEY CALL IT THE CARIBBEAN OF   
20110121023422.000|20110121023424.000|CC1|AFRICA, BUT THE VIBE IS KIND OF 
20110121023424.000|20110121023425.000|CC1|HARD TO PINPOINT.               
20110121023425.000|20110121023426.000|CC1|IT'S PART PORTUGUESE,           
20110121023426.000|20110121023428.000|CC1|PART AFRICAN.                   
20110121023428.000|20110121023429.000|CC1|IT'S A REAL MELTING POT.        
20110121023429.000|20110121023431.000|CC1|AND AT THE 2005 CENSUS, UP TO   
20110121023431.000|20110121023433.000|CC1|70% OF THE POPULATION WERE      
20110121023433.000|20110121023447.000|CC1|RECORDED TO BE MIXED RACE.      
20110121023447.000|20110121023448.000|CC1|20 MINUTES UP THE COAST         
20110121023448.000|20110121023450.000|CC1|FROM THE CAPITAL PRAIA IS       
20110121023450.000|20110121023452.000|CC1|RIBEIRA GRANDE, NOW CALLED      
20110121023452.000|20110121023454.000|CC1|CIDADE VELHA, OR OLD TOWN.      
20110121023454.000|20110121023456.000|CC1|THE CAPE VERDE ISLANDS WERE THE 
20110121023456.000|20110121023457.000|CC1|FIRST EUROPEAN COLONY IN ALL OF 
20110121023457.000|20110121023459.000|CC1|AFRICA, AND SETTLEMENT BEGAN    
20110121023459.000|20110121023502.000|CC1|HERE IN 1462, CENTERED AROUND   
20110121023502.000|20110121023504.000|CC1|THIS FERTILE VALLEY WHERE       
20110121023504.000|20110121023505.000|CC1|VISITING SHIPS WOULD PULL UP    
20110121023505.000|20110121023511.000|CC1|AND MAKE REPAIRS.               
20110121023511.000|20110121023513.000|CC1|RIBEIRA GRANDE'S SO LAID-BACK,  
20110121023513.000|20110121023514.000|CC1|IT'S HARD TO GET A FEELING FOR  
20110121023514.000|20110121023516.000|CC1|ACTUALLY WHAT WENT ON HERE AND  
20110121023516.000|20110121023518.000|CC1|THE ENORMITY OF ITS ROLE IN THE 
20110121023518.000|20110121023519.000|CC1|SLAVE TRADE.                    
20110121023519.000|20110121023520.000|CC1|AND THIS PILLORY, THE           
20110121023520.000|20110121023521.000|CC1|16th-CENTURY PILLORY IN THE     
20110121023521.000|20110121023523.000|CC1|CENTER OF TOWN REALLY TESTIFIES 
20110121023523.000|20110121023524.000|CC1|TO WHAT WENT ON.                
20110121023524.000|20110121023525.000|CC1|IT'S WHERE SLAVES WOULD BE      
20110121023525.000|20110121023527.000|CC1|SHACKLED AND POSSIBLY EVEN HUNG 
20110121023527.000|20110121023528.000|CC1|IN FRONT OF LARGE CROWDS        
20110121023528.000|20110121023535.000|CC1|OF PEOPLE.                      
20110121023535.000|20110121023537.000|CC1|FOR BUYERS, THE CAPE VERDE      
20110121023537.000|20110121023538.000|CC1|SLAVES WERE AN ATTRACTIVE       
20110121023538.000|20110121023540.000|CC1|PROSPECT.                       
20110121023540.000|20110121023541.000|CC1|THEY HAD ALREADY BEEN WRENCHED  
20110121023541.000|20110121023542.000|CC1|OUT OF AFRICA.                  
20110121023542.000|20110121023544.000|CC1|ONLY THE FIT HAD SURVIVED TO    
20110121023544.000|20110121023546.000|CC1|MAKE IT SO FAR.                 
20110121023546.000|20110121023547.000|CC1|AND ONCE THEY ARRIVED HERE, THE 
20110121023547.000|20110121023549.000|CC1|TRADERS HAD THEM BAPTIZED,      
20110121023549.000|20110121023551.000|CC1|FURTHER INCREASING THE SLAVES'  
20110121023551.000|20110121023555.000|CC1|MARKET VALUE.                   
20110121023555.000|20110121023557.000|CC1|THEY SAY THAT HALF THE HISTORY  
20110121023557.000|20110121023558.000|CC1|OF THESE ISLANDS IS BURIED

20110121023605.000|20110121023607.000|CC1|DIVER EMMANUEL OLIVERA TO TAKE

20110121023630.000|20110121023638.000|CC1|AROUND 10 METERS.               
20110121023638.000|20110121023640.000|CC1|FURTHER OUT, WE DISCOVER        
20110121023640.000|20110121023646.000|CC1|AN INCREDIBLE ANCHOR GRAVEYARD. 
20110121023646.000|20110121023647.000|CC1|AS MANY AS 30 SLAVE SHIPS       
20110121023647.000|20110121023649.000|CC1|REGULARLY ANCHORED HERE IN THE  
20110121023649.000|20110121023651.000|CC1|1600s, WORKING THE BOOMING      
20110121023651.000|20110121023656.000|CC1|SLAVE TRADE.                    
20110121023656.000|20110121023658.000|CC1|IT WASN'T UNTIL THE 1800s THAT  
20110121023658.000|20110121023659.000|CC1|THE CURVE-SHAPED ANCHOR         
20110121023659.000|20110121023701.000|CC1|WAS EVEN INVENTED.

20110121023702.000|20110121023704.000|CC1|A STRAIGHTER ARROWHEAD SHAPE

20110121023732.000|20110121023733.000|CC1|LIKE VISITING A GRAVEYARD TO

20110121025242.000|20110121025245.000|CC1|FALLS BY CANOE.                 
20110121025245.000|20110121025246.000|CC1|BUT IT ISN'T REALLY SAFE TO GO  
20110121025246.000|20110121025248.000|CC1|CLOSE TO THE EDGE OF THE FALLS  
20110121025248.000|20110121025249.000|CC1|IN A CANOE, AS FAST-FLOWING     
20110121025249.000|20110121025251.000|CC1|CURRENTS COULD DRAG YOU OVER

20110121025253.000|20110121025254.000|CC1|BY MOTORBOAT TO LIVINGSTONE     
20110121025254.000|20110121025305.000|CC1|ISLAND ON THE EDGE OF THE FALLS.
20110121025305.000|20110121025308.000|CC1|ON NOVEMBER 16, 1855,           
20110121025308.000|20110121025309.000|CC1|DAVID LIVINGSTONE ARRIVED ON    
20110121025309.000|20110121025311.000|CC1|THIS ISLAND BY CANOE AND WAS    
20110121025311.000|20110121025312.000|CC1|ABOUT TO LAY HIS EYES FOR THE   
20110121025312.000|20110121025314.000|CC1|FIRST TIME ON ONE OF THE        
20110121025314.000|20110121025317.000|CC1|WONDERS OF THE WORLD.           
20110121025317.000|20110121025318.000|CC1|AFTER ALL THAT HE'D BEEN        
20110121025318.000|20110121025320.000|CC1|THROUGH, ALL THE TRAUMA, THIS   
20110121025320.000|20110121025327.000|CC1|WAS THE SIGHT HE WAS GONNA SEE. 
20110121025327.000|20110121025332.000|CC1|OH, MY GOODNESS.                
20110121025332.000|20110121025334.000|CC1|LOOK AT THIS.                   
20110121025334.000|20110121025337.000|CC1|LIKE A MAGICAL POT OF GOLD.     
20110121025337.000|20110121025339.000|CC1|NO WONDER HIS FIRST WORDS WERE  
20110121025339.000|20110121025341.000|CC1|RELIGIOUS REVELRY.              
20110121025341.000|20110121025343.000|CC1|THIS IS A TRULY INSPIRING SPOT. 
20110121025343.000|20110121025344.000|CC1|IT'S HUGE BANKS OF              
20110121025344.000|20110121025352.000|CC1|STONE, WATER POURING DOWN.      
20110121025352.000|20110121025353.000|CC1|OVER 1 1/2 KILOMETERS           
20110121025353.000|20110121025355.000|CC1|WIDE AND AROUND 100 METERS      
20110121025355.000|20110121025357.000|CC1|HIGH, IN THE RAINY SEASON THE   
20110121025357.000|20110121025359.000|CC1|SPECTACULAR VICTORIA FALLS,     
20110121025359.000|20110121025400.000|CC1|WHICH SEPARATE ZAMBIA FROM ITS  
20110121025400.000|20110121025402.000|CC1|NEIGHBOR ZIMBABWE, FORM THE     
20110121025402.000|20110121025404.000|CC1|LARGEST SHEET OF FALLING WATER  
20110121025404.000|20110121025422.000|CC1|IN THE WORLD.                   
20110121025422.000|20110121025423.000|CC1|THE LOCAL TRIBES CALL           
20110121025423.000|20110121025425.000|CC1|THE FALLS MOSI-OA-TUNYA, WHICH  
20110121025425.000|20110121025427.000|CC1|MEANS THE SLOPE THAT THUNDERS.
